yanwittmann.utils

Class DateUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • yanwittmann.utils.DateUtils

  • public class DateUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Lots of date-related functions.
    For more information on dates see here and here.
    This class has been written by Yan Wittmann.
    Author:
    Yan Wittmann

    • Method Detail

      • parseString

        public static java.util.Date parseString(java.lang.String stringDate,
                                         java.lang.String format)
                                  throws java.text.ParseException
        Will parse a given string into a Date by creating a SimpleDateFormat from the format.
        The SimpleDateFormat locale will be set to Locale.ENGLISH.
        Returns:
        The parsed Date
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - If the string could not be parsed

      • parseString

        public static java.util.Date parseString(java.lang.String stringDate,
                                         java.text.SimpleDateFormat format)
                                  throws java.text.ParseException
        Will parse a given string into a Date using the SimpleDateFormat.
        Returns:
        The parsed Date
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - If the string could not be parsed

      • parseString

        public static java.util.Date parseString(java.lang.String stringDate)
                                  throws java.text.ParseException
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

      • parseString

        public static java.util.Date parseString(java.lang.String stringDate,
                                         boolean monthFirstThenDay)
                                  throws java.text.ParseException
        This is a powerful function that will attempt to read a string into a Date by guessing its format.
        Although a lot of different formats are supported, not every string is currently detected correctly.
        The matching order is the following: Year, Month, Day, Hour, Minute, Second, Millisecond.

        Parameters:
        stringDate - The string to parse into a Date
        Returns:
        The parsed date
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - If the string could not be parsed

      • formatDate

        public static java.lang.String formatDate(java.util.Date date,
                                          java.lang.String format)
        Will format a given date by creating a SimpleDateFormat from the format.
        The SimpleDateFormat locale will be set to Locale.ENGLISH.
        Returns:
        The formatted Date.

      • formatDate

        public static java.lang.String formatDate(java.util.Date date,

        Returns:
